description.narrative: GGF funds will support the partnership between the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew in England and the Universidad Autonoma de Mexico through the Facultad de Estudios Superiores Iztacala (FESI UNAM). Since 2002, these two organizations have safeguarded over 2,300 plant species in the arid and semi arid landscapes in Mexico. The project will allow the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew to expand their work through a new partner, the Universidad Autonoma de Baja California (UABC). The project will focus on conserving seeds from plant species which are endangered, endemic to a country or region, or of known or potential economic, cultural or environmental utility. The first objective will be to build capacity and enhance the skills base of partner organizations in Mexico devoted to the conservation and sustainable use of the indigenous plant life of Baja California. The project's second objective will be to undertake seed collections of rare and threatened endemic wild plants from the Baja California peninsula, with a target to ensure that genetically diverse collections of at least 225 species are processed, documented and stored in long term conservations, and are available to wider networks for research or restoration purposes.
